subject: Sexual Health
title: The Menstrual Cycle
description: A 60-second lesson on The Menstrual Cycle.

hook.text: Every month, the female body runs a complex program preparing itself for a potential pregnancy.

buildup.text: The cycle has four phases: menstruation, follicular, ovulation, and luteal. Each has a specific role.

discovery.text: Hormones rise and fall in a precise sequence, triggering egg release and uterine lining changes.

twist.text: Not every woman has a 28-day cycle. Normal cycles range from 21 to 35 days and vary with age.

climax.text: The menstrual cycle is one of the most intricate hormonal cascades in the entire human body.

punchline.text: A monthly symphony of hormones and timing.

quiz.question: How many phases does the menstrual cycle have?
